byline.contributor: Neil Gough contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

abstract: Political deadlock is hurting Australia's credit rating; Standard & Poor's says it could strip country of its top-grade investment grade in next two years, citing unclear political outlook among other factors.
lead_paragraph: Standard & Poor’s warned that it could lower Australia’s gilt-edged triple-A credit rating in the next two years in light of an inconclusive election.

headline.main: Amid Political Uncertainty, Australia Faces Ratings Downgrade
headline.print_headline: Its Politics Cloudy, Australia Faces Ratings Downgrade

snippet: Standard & Poor’s warned that it could lower Australia’s gilt-edged triple-A credit rating in the next two years in light of an inconclusive election....
